sen.e: In 1956 he moved to Toei Kyoto Movie Studios and directed many masterpieces with Kinnosuke YOROZUYA who was a star of Toei such as "Kaze to onna to tabigarasu" (Wind and a woman and a traveling crow) in which main characters daringly appeared with no make up on in the age when a star generally put on Shironuri (white makeup), "Mabuta no haha" (Mother of My Dreams) which was a revival of the masterpiece of Shin HASEGAWA, and a unique work "Sanada fuunroku" (Tale of the Sanada Family) which received high reputation as 'Nouvelle Vague of Toei Jidaigeki' including various factors of musical, critics against society.

sen.j: 東映が集団抗争時代劇から任侠路線へと移行する時期には、タイトルが加藤泰自身の代名詞ともなる最高傑作『沓掛時次郎 遊侠一匹』をものにし、新選組内部の抗争を描いたリアリズム時代劇『幕末残酷物語』などを撮り、そして、やくざの生きざまを独特の美意識と叙情で描いてその後の任侠映画に多大な影響を与えた『明治侠客伝 三代目襲名』を監督する。
sen.e: During the period when Toei shifted from mass vendetta Jidaigeki to men of chivalry, he directed "Kutsukake Tokijiro yukyo ippiki," his masterpiece which title became a byword of Tai KATO, "Brutal stories in the end of Edo Period" which was a realism Jidaigeki to present an internal conflict of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate), and "Meiji kyokakuden sandaime shumei" (a story of professional gambler in Meiji, the third succession) which presented the way of living of Japanese Mafia with a unique sense of beauty and lyric and gave a great impact on the later films on men of chivalry.

During a period in which Toei shifted from mass vendetta period dramas to yakuza films, Kato directed "Kutsukake Tokijiro yukyo ippiki," his masterpiece whose title became a byword for Tai KATO; "Brutal Tales from the End of the Edo Period" a realistic period drama about internal conflict in the Shinsengumi (a special police force at the end of the Tokugawa Shogunate); and "Meiji kyokakuden sandaime shumei" (The Story of a Meiji Knight, the Third Generation), which presented life in the Japanese Mafia with a unique sense of beauty and lyricism and greatly influenced later yakuza films.

sen.e: His creative activities reached a peak from 1967 to 1970; he directed the masterpiece "Oryu sanjo" (Appearance of Oryu (a woman's name)) in the series of "Hibotanbakuto" in which Junko FUJI played the lead, made a success of action movie such as 'Man's face is a personal history" and "Eighteen-year sentence" in which Noboru Ando played the lead, and directed "Showa onna bakuto," a revenge story with a kind of strange curse in which Kyoko ENAMI, who was a star of the film of men of chivalry in Daiei and moved to Toei, played the lead.
